info.title: iD Cloud APIs
info.description: iD Cloud is an RFID integration platform for retail.

get.description: Retrieves a list of approved difference list summaries for a given store.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location identifier of the store to retrieve the approved difference lists for.

parameters.name: from_rfid_time
parameters.description: Approved difference lists with RFID count time after this value will be returned.

parameters.name: until_rfid_time
parameters.description: Approved difference lists with RFID count time before this value will be returned.

get.description: Retrieves an approved difference list, using the approved difference list identifier.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier of the approved difference list

parameters.name: include_articles
parameters.description: Whether to include article details like name, size, etc. in the response.

parameters.name: accept
parameters.description: Content type to return.

get.description: Returns the summary of an approved difference list for a certain location and RFID count time.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location identifier of the store to retrieve the approved difference list summary for.

parameters.name: rfid_time
parameters.description: Date and time of the RFID count.

get.description: Exports an approved difference list, using the approved difference list identifier. This endpoint returns the approved difference list with only one quantity per GTIN: the RFID quantity if the difference for that GTIN has been approved, otherwise the ERP quantity. This endpoint returns all GTINs, even the ones where RFID and ERP quantities are equal.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Approved difference list identifier.

parameters.name: include_articles
parameters.description: Whether to include article details like name, size, etc. in the response.

post.description: Updates the export status of an approved difference list.
Creates or replaces article(s). Articles are replaced using the GTIN as primary key.

requestBody.description: A list of articles that should be created or replaced.

get.description: Retrieves articles. Optionally specify updated_after to retrieve articles updated after the given date and time. Use the skip and count parameters for pagination of results.

parameters.name: updated_after
parameters.description: Articles updated on or after this date and time. When omitted: return all articles.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Skip this number of articles. When omitted: skip none.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Return this number of articles. The maximum number of returned articles is limited to 50.000. When omitted: return 100 articles.

parameters.name: fields[]
parameters.description: List of fields (properties) of the article to return. Use this to limit the amount of data when not all article fields are needed. When omitted, all available fields are returned. Names of the fields should be given exactly as they appear in the API response. The GTIN field is always returned.

get.description: Retrieves articles associated with the given GTINs.

parameters.name: gtins[]
parameters.description: The GTIN(s) of the articles that should be returned. Repeat key-value for retrieving multiple GTINs.

parameters.name: fields[]
parameters.description: List of fields (properties) of the article to return. Use this to limit the amount of data when not all article fields are needed. When omitted, all available fields are returned. Names of the fields should be given exactly as they appear in the API response. The GTIN field is always returned.

get.description: Retrieves articles associated with the given barcode values.

parameters.name: barcodes[]
parameters.description: The barcode(s) of the articles that should be returned. Repeat key-value for retrieving multiple barcodes.

parameters.name: fields[]
parameters.description: List of fields (properties) of the article to return. Use this to limit the amount of data when not all article fields are needed. When omitted, all available fields are returned. Names of the fields should be given exactly as they appear in the API response. The GTIN field is always returned.

get.description: Retrieves articles associated with the given SKU codes. Note: this endpoint will not return more than 50000 articles, even if there are more matches.

parameters.name: sku_codes[]
parameters.description: The SKU code(s) of the articles that should be returned. Repeat key-value for retrieving multiple SKU codes.

parameters.name: fields[]
parameters.description: List of fields (properties) of the article to return. Use this to limit the amount of data when not all article fields are needed. When omitted, all available fields are returned. Names of the fields should be given exactly as they appear in the API response. The GTIN field is always returned.

get.description: Retrieves articles associated with the given option codes. The option codes will be matched to the field `option_code`. Note: this endpoint will not return more than 10000 articles, even if there are more matches.

parameters.name: option_codes[]
parameters.description: The option code(s) of the articles that should be returned. Repeat key-value for retrieving multiple option codes.

parameters.name: fields[]
parameters.description: List of fields (properties) of the article to return. Use this to limit the amount of data when not all article fields are needed. When omitted, all available fields are returned. Names of the fields should be given exactly as they appear in the API response. The GTIN field is always returned.

get.description: Finds articles based on a search query that allows search in all fields. Use the skip and count parameters for pagination of results.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query. Comma separated values to search for in the articles database (â€˜AND' query). Search will be executed on all fields and is case insensitive

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Skip this number of articles. When omitted: skip none.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Return this number of articles. The maximum number of returned articles is limited to 50.000. When omitted: return 100 articles.

parameters.name: extern_ref
parameters.description: This can be used to match requests with responses from the server (for example, Ajax requests are asynchronous and thus can return out of sequence).

parameters.name: order[]
parameters.description: Column to which ordering should be applied. When omitted: default order wil be based on score.

parameters.name: fields[]
parameters.description: List of fields (properties) of the article to return. Use this to limit the amount of data when not all article fields are needed. When omitted, all available fields are returned. Names of the fields should be given exactly as they appear in the API response. The GTIN field is always returned.

get.description: Returns the total quantity of articles stored.

delete.description: Deletes specified articles from the database. This cannot be undone! Please note the articles are not deleted from the apps. To do that, reset the app and re-register using the QR code.

parameters.name: gtins[]
parameters.description: GTIN(s) to delete. Repeat key-value for deleting multiple articles.

delete.description: Deletes all articles from the database. This cannot be undone! Please note the articles are not deleted from the apps. To do that, reset the app and re-register using the QR code.

get.description:
API for synchronizing the article database and keeping it in sync. This API works like an iterator. Each response includes a list of articles (including deleted articles) and a token. The token must be provided with the next requests. The first request leaves the token empty, which indicates that synchronization starts from the beginning. When the response is empty, the synchronization has finished. The token that is returned can be used to continue synchronization at a later moment (for example the next day). It will then only retrieve articles that have changed since the last synchronization call.
The server is allowed to invalidate a token via a 410 response status code, which means that it is no longer possible for the client to synchronize using that token. At this point, a client should invalidate its article database and do a full synchronization (starting with a request that has no token).
Tokens will expire after a certain amount of time, but typically will be valid for multiple days. This means that for example a daily task that needs a replica of article information can (and should) reuse tokens and the article information.
Deleted articles are provided via the deleted_articles response field. Due to optimizations in the article synchronization implementation, it could happen that a client receives deletes for articles that it has never seen.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The token used to advance the synchronization. When omitted, synchronization starts from the beginning.

410.description: The request token has expired or invalidated (gone), and can no longer be used to synchronize. A client must do a full synchronization from the start.

get.description: Retrieves GTIN-based difference list for a single location. By default, only items with an ERP stock quantity that is different from the RFID count quantity are returned.

parameters.name: erp_stock_id
parameters.description: Identifier of the ERP stock to use.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Date and time of the RFID count to be used.

parameters.name: only_differences
parameters.description: When set to true, only differences will be returned. When set to false, all GTINs in the ERP stock or RFID stock will be returned (except when both are zero).

parameters.name: include_articles
parameters.description: Whether to include article details like name, size, etc. in the response.

404.description: No RFID count for specified time

get.description: Retrieves GTIN-based difference list for a single location. By default, only items with an ERP stock quantity that is different from the RFID count quantity are returned. Items in difference are grouped by article category.

parameters.name: erp_stock_id
parameters.description: Identifier of the ERP stock to use.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Date and time of the RFID count to be used.

parameters.name: only_differences
parameters.description: When set to true, only differences will be returned. When set to false, all GTINs in the ERP stock or RFID stock will be returned (except when both are zero).

parameters.name: include_articles
parameters.description: Whether to include article details like name, size, etc. in the response.

404.description: No RFID count for specified time

post.description: Create or replace a display compliance suggestions list. Any previous display compliance suggestions list (for that given store) will be replaced. Note that each article as referred by the GTIN must exist in the !D Cloud article database. If it doesn't exist then error code 400 is returned. Same applies for the location. Note that field "record_time" is automatically filled by !D Cloud and thus should be omitted from the input.

400.description: - One ore more required fields are missing or have invalid format. - Location doesn't exist. - Number of put-on and take-off suggestions exceeding 50K. - Article as referred by option code doesn't exist in the !D Cloud article database.

get.description: Response contains a list of put-on suggestions for the requested store. The put-on suggestions are ordered by 1) "stars" and 2) "priority". For each put-on suggestions there can be 0, 1 or more take-off suggestions. The take-off suggestions are ordered by priority.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location ID of store.

404.description: When no display compliance suggestion list exists for given store.

delete.description: Deletes the display compliance suggestion list for the specified store.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location ID of store.

404.description: When no display compliance suggestion list exists for given store.

post.description: Captures and stores EPCIS events. This does not imply any relationship between these EPCIS events.

requestBody.description: A list of EPCIS events to be captured.

post.description: Queries and retrieves EPCIS event(s) that match the criteria specified in the query parameters. If no query parameters are provided, the query will match all EPCIS events. If more than one query parameters are provided, events are returned only if they match for all the parameters. If more than one value for a query parameter is provided, events must match at least one of the values. Cursors can be used to iterate through large result sets. See the guidelines on the developer portal for more information on how to use cursors, and the details about the supported parameters.

requestBody.description: Query parameter object. If two or more query parameters are defined, then the AND operation is always applied.

post.description: Queries and retrieves EPCIS event(s) from the EPCIS long term storage. This API provides access to all EPCIS events that are captured and stored in the EPCIS repository, where the `/epcis/v3/query` API provides access to only the EPCIS events that are captured in the last 24 months. However, this API is less flexible when compared to `/epcis/v3/query`, where it only allows to search based on event time, disposition, business step and business location. If no query parameters are provided, the query will match all EPCIS events. If more than one query parameter is provided, events are returned only if they match all parameters. If more than one value for a query parameter is provided, events must match at least one of the values. Cursors are used to iterate through large result sets. This means that this API will never report an error if there are more events matching the query than returned. The `has_more` field in the response will be set to `true` if there are more events matching than returned. The `next_cursor` field will contain the cursor that can be used to retrieve the next batch of EPCIS events. See the guidelines on the developer portal for more information on how to use cursors, and the details about the supported parameters.

requestBody.description: If two or more query parameters are defined, then the AND operation is always applied.

post.description: Creates a snapshot of the stock levels of a store according to the ERP system ("ERP stock").

get.description: Lists the ERP stock summaries for a given location. This endpoint returns maximum 100 summaries per call.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location for which to list the ERP stocks.

parameters.name: from_event_time
parameters.description: Retrieve the ERP stock summaries from this time.

parameters.name: until_event_time
parameters.description: Retrieve the ERP stock summaries until this time.

get.description: Retrieves details of an ERP stock for a given identifier.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the ERP stock to retrieve.

parameters.name: with_excluded
parameters.description: Boolean parameter that indicates if we want to include excluded GTINs from ERP stock.

get.description: Retrieves a summary for an ERP stock.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of the ERP stock summary to retrieve.

get.description: Provides weekly approved difference list accuracy for organization or division.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Optional. String, location identifier from device management. If omitted, accuracy for organization will be returned. Mutually exclusive with division_id.

parameters.name: division_id
parameters.description: Optional. Numeric division ID (target ID) from device management. If omitted, accuracy for organization will be returned. Mutually exclusive with location.

parameters.name: number_of_weeks
parameters.description: Optional. Number of weeks to go in history (minimum 1, maximum 53). If omitted default is 10. Mutually exclusive with from_week and to_week parameters.

parameters.name: from_week
parameters.description: Optional. Starting point in time from which to return weekly aggregates. Must be in yyyy-ww format. Must be specified together with to_week parameter. Must be less than to_week parameter.

parameters.name: to_week
parameters.description: Optional. Ending point in time to which to return weekly aggregates. Must be in yyyy-ww format. Must be specified together with from_week parameter. Must be greater than from_week parameter.

get.description: Provides last week's approved difference list accuracy for organization or division.

parameters.name: division_id
parameters.description: Optional. Numeric division ID (target ID) from device management. If omitted, aggregated data for the entire organization is returned.

parameters.name: list_stores
parameters.description: Optional. If set to true, instead of returning child divisions and stores, it will return flat list of all store descendants (all depth levels) for given division. If set to false, it will return child divisions and stores, only child entities are included, not all descendants. If omitted, defaults to false.

get.description: Provides approved difference list accuracy for organization or division for specific week.

parameters.name: division_id
parameters.description: Optional. Numeric division ID (target ID) from device management. If omitted, aggregated data for the entire organization is returned.

parameters.name: year_week
parameters.description: Mandatory. Specific week for which to return aggregates. Must be in yyyy-ww format.

parameters.name: list_stores
parameters.description: Optional. If set to true, instead of returning child divisions and stores, it will return flat list of all store descendants (all depth levels) for given division. If set to false, it will return child divisions and stores, only child entities are included, not all descendants. If omitted, defaults to false.

parameters.description: Optional. String, location identifier from device management. If omitted, accuracy for organization will be returned. Mutually exclusive with division_id.

parameters.name: division_id
parameters.description: Optional. Numeric division ID (target ID) from device management. If omitted, accuracy for organization will be returned. Mutually exclusive with location.

parameters.name: number_of_weeks
parameters.description: Optional. Number of weeks to go in history (minimum 1, maximum 53). If omitted default is 10. Mutually exclusive with from_week and to_week parameters.

parameters.name: from_week
parameters.description: Optional. Starting point in time from which to return weekly aggregates. Must be in yyyy-ww format. Must be specified together with to_week parameter. Must be less than to_week parameter.

parameters.name: to_week
parameters.description: Optional. Ending point in time to which to return weekly aggregates. Must be in yyyy-ww format. Must be specified together with from_week parameter. Must be greater than from_week parameter.

get.description: Provides last week's on shelf availability for organization or division.

parameters.name: division_id
parameters.description: Optional. Numeric division ID (target ID) from device management. If omitted, aggregated data for the entire organization is returned.

parameters.name: list_stores
parameters.description: Optional. If set to true, instead of returning child divisions and stores, it will return flat list of all store descendants (all depth levels) for given division. If set to false, it will return child divisions and stores, only child entities are included, not all descendants. If omitted, defaults to false.

get.description: Provides on shelf availability for organization or division for specific week.

parameters.name: division_id
parameters.description: Optional. Numeric division ID (target ID) from device management. If omitted, aggregated data for the entire organization is returned.

parameters.name: year_week
parameters.description: Mandatory. Specific week for which to return aggregates. Must be in yyyy-ww format.

parameters.name: list_stores
parameters.description: Optional. If set to true, instead of returning child divisions and stores, it will return flat list of all store descendants (all depth levels) for given division. If set to false, it will return child divisions and stores, only child entities are included, not all descendants. If omitted, defaults to false.

get.description: Provides daily on shelf availability V2 for a specific location.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Required. String, location identifier from device management.

parameters.name: number_of_days
parameters.description: Optional. Number of days to go in history (minimum 1, maximum 31). If omitted default is 7. Mutually exclusive with from_date and to_date parameters.

parameters.name: from_date
parameters.description: Optional. Starting point in time from which to return daily aggregates. Must be in yyyy-mm-dd format. Must be specified together with to_day parameter. Must be less than or equal to to_day parameter.

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description: Optional. Ending point in time to which to return daily aggregates. Must be in yyyy-mm-dd format. Must be specified together with from_date parameter. Must be greater than or equal to from_day parameter.

get.description:
Returns the real time stock at a certain location in unique items (SGTINs). Items are returned based on their last known bizLocation (location). The response contains a list of stocks for all matching (sub)locations based on the given parameters:
* If the stock for a store without sublocations is requested, the stocks list in the response will contain one entry containing the stock for the entire store.
* If a store has sublocations, the list of stocks in the response will contain an entry each for the sublocations.
* If a store has stock for both sublocations and store, the list of stocks in the response contains entries for the store and the sublocations with stock.
* When no dispositions are specified, this endpoint only returns items with dispositions urn:epcglobal:cbv:disp:sellable_accessible or urn:epcglobal:cbv:disp:sellable_not_accessible.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location identifier of a store or a sublocation.

parameters.name: location_types[]
parameters.description:
Filter on (sub)location types: only stock on (sub)locations of the specified types will be returned. Multiple  (sub)location types can be specified.
Valid (sub)location types are:
    STOCK_ROOM, SALES_FLOOR,
    OFFSITE_STORAGE,
    FOREIGN and SITE.
Default behavior is to return stocks for all (sub)location types except FOREIGN.

parameters.name: dispositions[]
parameters.description: Filter on disposition(s): only stock of the specified disposition(s) will be returned. If omitted, only items with dispositions urn:epcglobal:cbv:disp:sellable_accessible or urn:epcglobal:cbv:disp:sellable_not_accessible are included.

parameters.name: after_timestamp
parameters.description: Only include EPCs in the response that have `timestamp` field greater or equal to specified date/time.

get.description: Returns realtime stock mutation log. Note that all the filter parameters are optional. Maximum number of mutations that can be retrieved per request is limited to 10000. The list is ordered by (first) time and (second) epc descending.

parameters.name: from_time
parameters.description: Search for realtime stock mutation logs from or at this datetime.

parameters.name: until_time
parameters.description: Search for realtime stock mutation logs before or at this datetime.

parameters.name: epc_uris[]
parameters.description: Filter on zero or more EPCs values in EPC pure identity URI (SGTIN) format.

parameters.name: gtins[]
parameters.description: Filter on GTIN values.

parameters.name: biz_steps[]
parameters.description: Filter on biz-step values.

parameters.name: mutation_types[]
parameters.description: Filter on mutation types.

parameters.name: from_locations[]
parameters.description: Filter on location identifiers of locations where items were registered on before the mutation.

parameters.name: from_dispositions[]
parameters.description: Filter on dispositions that items had before the mutation.

parameters.name: to_locations[]
parameters.description: Filter on location identifiers of locations where items are registered on after the mutation.

parameters.name: to_dispositions[]
parameters.description: Filter on disposition(s) that items have after the mutation.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of items to retrieve (per request). Default is 500.

parameters.name: pagination_time
parameters.description: When response.pagination.has_more from the initial request returns true, you can provide the returned pagination.time (together with pagination_epc_uri) to get the next result set of mutations repeatedly until response.pagination.has_more returns false.

parameters.name: pagination_epc_uri
parameters.description: When response.pagination.has_more from the initial request returns true, you can provide the returned pagination.epc_uri (together with pagination.time) to get the next result set of mutations repeatedly until response.pagination.has_more returns false. This parameter serves as a so called 'tie breaker id' for cases where multiple mutations with the exact same time exist, because the epc_uri then helps us determine the exact position where we "left off".

post.description: Register items that have been commissioned: labels have been printed or programmed and attached to an item. This transaction will be registered as an EPCIS event with bizStep `urn:epcglobal:cbv:bizstep:commissioning` and disposition `urn:epcglobal:cbv:disp:active`.

Item(s) are customized. This transaction will be registered as an EPCIS event with bizStep `http://nedapretail.com/bizstep/customizing` and disposition `http://nedapretail.com/disp/customized` when being customized or `http://nedapretail.com/disp/hemming` when being hemmed. Only one of being_customized and being_hemmed may be set to true.

Puts item(s) on dispay. This transaction will be registered as an EPCIS event with bizStep `http://nedapretail.com/bizstep/displaying` and disposition `http://nedapretail.com/disp/on_display` when put on display.

Item(s) that are (partly) sold are being held for a customer and awaiting pick-up. Examples: click&collect, bopis, lay-bys e.g. This transaction will be registered as an EPCIS event with bizStep `urn:epcglobal:cbv:bizstep:holding` and disposition `urn:epcglobal:cbv:disp:non_sellable_other` when held or `http://nedapretail.com/disp/received_order` when set to received order. Only one of held and received_order may be set to true.

Inspects item(s) which are concluded to be damaged, faulty or missing. This transaction will be registered as an EPCIS event with bizStep `urn:epcglobal:cbv:bizstep:inspecting` and disposition `urn:epcglobal:cbv:disp:damaged` when damaged, `http://nedapretail.com/disp/faulty` when faulty or `http://nedapretail.com/disp/missing_article` when the article is missing. Only one of damaged, fault and article_missing may be set to true.

Lends item(s) to a third-party. This transaction will be registered as an EPCIS event with bizStep `http://nedapretail.com/bizstep/lending` and disposition `http://nedapretail.com/disp/lent` when lent.

Move item(s) between sublocations within the same store. This transaction will be registered as an EPCIS event with bizStep `urn:epcglobal:cbv:bizstep:storing` when moving to a stockroom, or bizStep `urn:epcglobal:cbv:bizstep:stocking` when moving to a sales floor.

Item(s) are temporarily reserved for a customer. The item is awaiting pickup by the customer. Examples: e-reservation, reservation by telephone. This transaction will be registered as an EPCIS event with bizStep `http://nedapretail.com/bizstep/retail_reserving` and disposition `http://nedapretail.com/disp/retail_reserved` when reserved.
Mark items as returned. This transaction will be registered as an EPCIS event with bizStep `urn:epcglobal:cbv:bizstep:retail_selling`.

requestBody.description: Information about the items and their new state.

post.description: Mark item(s) as returned by GTIN. This transaction will be registered as an EPCIS event with bizStep `urn:epcglobal:cbv:bizstep:retail_selling`. Because the request does not contain serialized item references, this transaction will not be processed in realtime stock. Use serialized item references when possible.

requestBody.description: Information about the items and their new state.

get.description: Return a list of (summaries of) webhook deliveries. The time of a delivery is the moment the first delivery attempt is done. The returned deliveries are ordered newest to oldest time. Use the from_time and until_time parameters to list deliveries for a specific time frame, use the from_delivery parameter to iterate through all deliveries (set from_delivery to the delivery UUID of the last returned delivery of your previous call). Use the only_failed parameter to only return failed deliveries. A delivery is failed when the maximum number of retries has been reached and the delivery is still unsuccessful. Use the returned delivery ID to retrieve or redeliver the webhook using the relevant endpoint.

parameters.name: subscription_id
parameters.description: Identifier of subscription to retrieve webhook deliveries for.

parameters.name: from_time
parameters.description: Retrieve deliveries newer than specified time. Specified time may not be more than 100 days in the past. The time of a delivery is the moment the first delivery attempt is done. This parameter is ignored when from_delivery is specified. If this parameter is not specified, the default is 30 days ago.

parameters.name: until_time
parameters.description: Retrieve deliveries older than specified time. The time of a delivery is the moment the first delivery attempt is done. This parameter is ignored when from_delivery is specified. If this parameter is not specified, the default is the current date/time.

parameters.name: from_delivery
parameters.description: Retrieve deliveries older than or same as from_delivery.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of deliveries to retrieve (maximum 1000).

parameters.name: only_failed
parameters.description: Only return failed deliveries. Note: setting this to true could return less deliveries than the number specified in the limit parameter as only the last 1000 deliveries within the specified timeframe are inspected.

get.description: Retrieve webhook delivery by id.

parameters.name: subscription_id
parameters.description: Identifier of subscription.

parameters.name: delivery
parameters.description: Identifier of webhook delivery to retrieve.

404.description: When webhook delivery could not be found

post.description: Request to redeliver a webhook delivery

gtin.description: GTIN-14, length of 14 digits. Primary key to identify an article (or SKU). GTIN-14 value is validated against the GS1 standard. When no GTIN-14 is provided, it will be generated and unique for this organization.

barcodes.description: Contains all barcodes for this article, for example EAN-13 and UPC-12. Minimum of 1 linear barcode is required.

code.description: Article code as assigned by the retailer. No relation to GTIN or other barcodes is assumed.

season.description: The season the product belongs to.

option.description: Description of the option. The field option_code is used to group articles, refer to options, etc. while this field is shown in user interfaces to describe an option. When omitted: option is automatically filled with the value of the name and color fields.

style.description: Name of the article, independent of color. When omitted: style is automatically filled with name.

supplier.description: Supplier name. Can also be factory name.

category.description: Category name. Used to group articles (or SKU's) in the web interface and the apps

department.description: Department. Used for grouping multiple categories.

prices.description: Contains various prices that can be country specific.

gender.description: Contains the gender. This is free format, but is intended to contain e.g. Male.

sku_code.description: Stock Keeping Unit code. When omitted: sku_code is automatically filled with "GTIN-" plus value of gtin field.

option_code.description: Option code of the article. All articles within the same option_code should only differ in size. This field is used to refer to an option in APIs and group relevant articles. The option field is used to refer to an option in user interfaces, the option_code field is not shown in user interfaces. When omitted: option_code is automatically filled with the value of the option field.

age_group.description: Contains the age group. This is free format, but is intended to contain e.g. Child.

refill_category.description: The category used as a key for the refill feature. When omitted category, age group, and gender will be used by default for refill.

image_url.description: A valid url containing an image. The image should be in JPEG, GIF or PNG format and not too large (maximum 250 kB).

last_updated.description: The time when the article was last updated. This field will be overwritten when new article data is uploaded.

rfid_tagged.description: Indicates how this article is tagged.

custom_label_field1.description: Field used for printing customized RFID labels.

custom_label_field2.description: Field used for printing customized RFID labels.

custom_label_field3.description: Field used for printing customized RFID labels.

fabric.description: Description of the fabric the article is made of.

gs1_company_prefix_length.description: GS1 Company Prefix Length that is used to program RFID labels for this GTIN. If omitted, this field will be filled with the value published by GS1 in the GS1 Company Prefix (GCP) Length Table. If the GS1 Company Prefix of this GTIN is not in the list, a default value of 7 will be used.

type.description: Barcode type. Typically ean_13 or upc_12. Values are described in lowercase, digits and underscores. Values can include ean_8, ean_13, upc_12, gs1_128, code_39.

location.description: Location identifier of the store.

expiration_date.description: Time at which the target is no longer valid. At that time, the targets will be removed for the store. The expiration_date can not be larger than 6 months from now and also defaults to 6 months.

priority.description: Unbounded positive number. Is used to order put-on suggestions within the same stars group. If omitted, value 1 will be used.

showcased.description: When true, items are set to showcased. When false (and displayed is not set to true), the items are removed from the display.

faulty.description: When true, items are set to faulty. When false (and damaged and missing_article are not set to true), the items are returned as part of the stock.

missing_article.description: When true, items are set to missing. When false (and damaged and faulty are not set to true), the items are returned as part of the stock.

initial_sync.description: Every synchronization starts with a full copy of the entire set of articles. After the initial synchronization is completed, it will continue with synchronising the changes that have occurred since the initial synchronization started. This field indicates whether the process has completed the initial sync (returning false) or not (returning true). Note that the synchronization may not be complete after the initial sync completes, since updates to articles may have occurred concurrently while doing an initial synchronization. To check if the synchronization is completed, use `has_more`.

output_quantity_list.description: An unordered list of one or more QuantityElements identifying (at the class level) objects that were outputs from the transformation.

transformation_id.description: A unique identifier that links this event to other TransformationEvents having an identical value of 'transformationID'.

type.description: An identifier that indicates what kind of business transaction this BusinessTransaction denotes.

biz_transaction.description: An identifier that denotes a specific business transaction.

declaration_time.description: The date and time at which the declaration of error is made.

reason.description: An element from a standard vocabulary that specifies the reason the prior event is considered erroneous.

corrective_event_ids.description: If present, indicates that the events having the specified URIs as the value of their eventID fields are to be considered as "corrections" to the event declared erroneous by this event.

ResultErrorDeclaration.description: A ErrorDeclaration is a structure that identifies a prior EPCISEvent is in error.

quantity.description: A number that specifies how many or how much of the specified EPCClass is denoted by this QuantityElement.

uom.description: If present, specifies a unit of measure by which the specified quantity is to be interpreted as a physical measure, specifying how much of the specified EPCClass is denoted by this QuantityElement.

epc_class.description: A class-level identifier for the class to which the specified quantity of objects belongs.

ResultQuantityElement.description: A QuantityElement is a structure that identifies objects identified by a specific class-level identifier, either a specific quantity or an unspecified quantity.

type.description: An identifier that indicates what kind of destination this Destination denotes.

destination.description: An identifier that denotes a specific destination.

type.description: An identifier that indicates what kind of source this Source denotes.

source.description: An identifier that denotes a specific source.

type.description: An identifier that indicates what kind of source this Source denotes.

source.description: An identifier that denotes a specific source.

parent_id.description: The identifier of the parent of the objects given in epcList and quantityList.

epc_list.description: An unordered list of the EPCs of the objects identified by instance-level identifiers associated with the business transaction.

quantity_list.description: An unordered list of one or more QuantityElements identifying objects (at the class level) to which the event pertained.

input_epc_list.description: An unordered list of one or more EPCs identifying (at the instance level) objects that were inputs to the transformation.

output_epc_list.description: An unordered list of one or more EPCs naming (at the instance level) objects that were outputs from the transformation.

input_quantity_list.description: An unordered list of one or more QuantityElements identifying (at the class level) objects that were inputs to the transformation.

output_quantity_list.description: An unordered list of one or more QuantityElements identifying (at the class level) objects that were outputs from the transformation.

transformation_id.description: A unique identifier that links this event to other TransformationEvents having an identical value of 'transformationID'.
